author: Jason Romain
comment: Please add the ability to have a custom location rather than requiring the location services to be enabled.

reply.author: Felker Tech
reply.content: Hi Jason. The main purpose of the app is to tell you how the weather around you is going to change over the course of the day. However, if you do want to change the location, you can go into the settings and enable VPN Mode. This will open a prompt where you can directly add in coordinates for the location you're choosing. Let me know if this works

author: dgw
comment: Android TV support is great to have, but the introduction cards that are shown on first run cannot be dismissed with any of the buttons on the Nexus Player remote. I had to open the Remote Control app on my phone and experiment to find the only way that worked: opening the keyboard and hitting the Enter/Done button. Otherwise it seems to work well enough. Being able to see where the app thinks my device is located when in the daydream view would be nice. Does the daydream show more detail in premium mode?

reply.author: Felker Tech
reply.content:
Hmm, I'm sorry about this. It was working fine on the gamepad, but I suppose the same keys aren't mapped for the remote. This should be fixed soon. Thanks for letting me know.

The daydream feature is rudimentary. The premium version gives more themes, but it doesn't give more information. Let me know what you're looking for felker.tech@gmail.ccom

title: Can't get started with just Nexus Player remote

author: Huy Ly
comment: If your going to offer an option and push notifications based on it, I'd be a good idea to make sure your metric conversions work properly. I have 40° set as hot and 12° as cold and I just got a notification saying it will be very hot at 15°. Thought this would be fixed long ago but kept the app around and it still hasn't been addressed. Daydream also is just in nonstandard (I refuse to validate it) measurements with no option to switch to metric

reply.author: Felker Tech
reply.content: I'm sorry that you've been having trouble with metric units. As the US still uses imperial I haven't had too much testing with metric. It's weird that you're getting a notification for 15° and I'll definitely investigate why that's happening. As for daydreams, I'll also check that out. It should use whichever system you pick though.

title: Please fix metric to nonstandard(imperial) measurements

author: Chris M
comment: Can't get past the last card on the welcome screen, it doesn't let me select the checkmark at the end.

reply.author: Felker Tech
reply.content: Thanks for letting me know. Others have reported that the remote doesn't work, even though it does work on the gamepad. A fix will be released shortly.

title: Doesn't work on Android TV

author: Gil Hamlin
comment: I'm experiencing issues with the Android Wear watchface. It immediately crashes upon selection. I've experienced this on both a moto 360 and a LG Watch Urbane.

reply.author: Felker Tech
reply.content:
Shoot me an email (felker.tech@gmail.com). I've gotten a few reports of this happening but I haven't been able to reproduce it yet.

Edit: This app has had a few updates recently. Try upgrading and see if you have any problems.

title: Android Wear Issues

author: Eddie Young
comment: Worked well on phone so upgraded so as to use the Android Wear app. On running on the watch, repeatedly says the app has stopped. Pity.

reply.author: Felker Tech
reply.content:
Hey there. I'm really sorry that you haven't been able to get that to work. I haven't been seeing any problems on my devices. Send me an email so we can further debug your problem.

Edit: A new update might fix this issue.

title: Won't run on Android Wear Watch

author: Kevin Winn
comment: Literally the most inaccurate (and needlessly complex) weather app I've ever tried. And the daydream screen is stationary. Always. Never moves. Perfect if you want a 54 degrees notification forever burned into your TV screen.

reply.author: Felker Tech
reply.content:
The daydream bug is a known. I'm sorry you're having this issue. It will be fixed soon.

Accuracy is unfortunately up to the service as it's using 3rd party APIs. 

Can you explain what you mean by needlessly complex? The goal is to display lots of data in a glanceable way. If you have any suggestions, please let me know at felker.tech@gmail.com

title: 54 degrees all the time. 😐

reply.author: Felker Tech
reply.content: I'm sorry. This app does not have any ads in it at all. If you're seeing this problem, I would consider making sure you've downloaded a valid version of the app and that your system hasn't been compromised elsewhere.

author: Mohamed Abdalla
comment: I can not rate it even by one star because it is not working

reply.author: Felker Tech
reply.content: The bug fix is rolling out now, you should see it soon.

title: Not working
